sentences.en: "Welcome back" was all they said. I could have kissed them!
sentences.cn: 他们只是说，“欢迎回来。”我真想亲他们一下！

sentences.en: By the time she was eight, she could read Greek and Latin.
sentences.cn: 她八岁时就会读希腊文和拉丁文了。

sentences.en: Could you hear what I was saying?
sentences.cn: 你能听到我说的话吗？

sentences.en: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball.
sentences.cn: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

sentences.en: Distantly, to her right, she could make out the town of Chiffa.
sentences.cn: 在她右边，远远的，她依稀能辨认出希法镇。

sentences.en: He could just about see the little man behind the counter.
sentences.cn: 他勉强能看到柜台后面的小个子男人。

sentences.en: His style could scarcely be further removed from that of his predecessor.
sentences.cn: 他的风格几乎和他的前辈如出一辙。

sentences.en: I could do it, he mused.
sentences.cn: 我能做这件事，他沉思着。

sentences.en: I could see that something was terribly wrong.
sentences.cn: 我能看出有很大麻烦了。

sentences.en: I could use some money, Sarah told him flatly.
sentences.cn: 萨拉态度坚决地告诉他，我可以用一部分钱。

sentences.en: I couldn’t get tickets after all, they were sold out.
sentences.cn: 我最终还是没能弄到票，全都卖完了。

sentences.en: I knew I couldn’t afford the rent.
sentences.cn: 我知道我付不起租金。

sentences.en: In those days you could buy a box of cigars for a dollar.
sentences.cn: 那时候，一美元能买一盒雪茄烟。

sentences.en: It was feared they could break the Allies' codes.
sentences.cn: 恐怕他们会破译盟军的密码。

sentences.en: My eyes were so swollen I could hardly see.
sentences.cn: 我的眼睛肿得很厉害，几乎看不到东西。

sentences.en: Northbridge is a cool, calculating and clever criminal who could strike again.
sentences.cn: 诺思布里奇是个头脑冷静、诡计多端、阴险狡诈的罪犯，他可能还会犯案。

sentences.en: Politicians say it could lead to a dissolution of parliament.
sentences.cn: 政客们说这可能会导致议会解散。

sentences.en: She could hear his ragged breathing, as if he had been running.
sentences.cn: 她能听到他不均匀的呼吸声，似乎他是跑着过来的。

sentences.en: So, if we could just move onto something else?
sentences.cn: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

sentences.en: The teacher said we could all go home.
sentences.cn: 老师说我们都可以回家了。

sentences.en: They could interpret it that way if they'd a mind to.
sentences.cn: 如果他们愿意的话，可以那样理解。

sentences.en: This could be the feel-good movie of the autumn.
sentences.cn: 这可以称得上是今秋令人赏心悦目的影片了。

sentences.en: When I left school at 16, I couldn't read or write.
sentences.cn: 我16岁离开学校时不会读也不会写。

sentences.en: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it.
sentences.cn: 风险不可能完全消除，但可以通过防范和培训来降低。

phrases.tran_cn: 本来能做成的（却没做成）
没人能做到；那么别人也休想

trans.tran_cn: “can”的过去式，能够，打算，用于假设语气的条件句，用于虚拟语气的结论句

trans.tran_en: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past

trans.tran_cn: 能，会，可以（can的过去式），可能，本来可以，真想
trans.tran_en: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
You use could to indicate that someone had the ability to do something. You use could not or couldn't to say that someone was unable to do something.
